transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (now sitting at his desk) On tonight's show -

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (off camera, on the monitor, in very strained voice, without moving his lips) Can you hear me? Can you hear... Can you take me... Can you get my message? Do you hear what I'm saying? (exhales)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: William Shatner!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: That's incorrect.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bill Shatman!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looking at his blue card, squinting)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (gestures toward himself) I'm the space guy. I'm Captain Kirk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Outer space shows are for children and stupid people.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: What are you, some -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on, Shaq.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: How can we -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Let me just, um, rub my eyes here, for a moment. (Puts his head in his hand. grimacing) Oh, man. (turns his head back and forth several times, and grits his teeth) Oh, do I itch.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I thought, that I was, I was coming here to publicize.. some of my projects, I'm ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (shakes his head back and forth very rapidly) Ow, I shouldn't be itching like this. Oh, man.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I have the urge to leave.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Food court's downstairs if you want to scope out some eye candy, Bill.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Funny, funny how those words came out of you, and, (pointing at his temple) and it shows you  the mind meld is working.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bang a left past the four-dimensional bielectric transfer portal. Here, I'll open it for ya. I forgot how primative you are. (presses one of his power band buttons)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You should really get one of these on your show. Oh wait, you don't have a show. (Scoots his chair closer to the monitor) You don't have a show. (laughs) (Multiple images of SG appear on Bill's monitor, all chanting "You don't have a show!")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Hey, remember that one Space Trek episode where your show got cancelled? Remember that one?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: No. I remember nothing about Star -

transcript.speaker: (Alarm goes off, with red lights flashing. The camera changes in sequence
transcript.dialogue: Moltar in the control room, watching a Dino Boy cartoon on his monitor; Zorak in his keyboard pod; Bill on the monitor; The leprechaun; Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Double red alert! That sound means it's time for my death struggle with Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Space Ghost... (throws lever up and down, cancelling the alarm sound and lights) Zorak had to cancel.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Says he's got a heating and air conditioning guy comin' over to his house to blow out his ducts.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sitting in his keyboard pod, looking at Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You mind covering for him?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go by his house and let the guy in. That way, the death struggle happens and the ducts get blown.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, I don't have a key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you get a key then?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I don't have a key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you get a key then?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (beat) I don't have a key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies from his desk; he walks in behind Moltar, surprising him) Why don't you get a key then?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Wha! (Beat) I don't have a -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you get a -

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: - key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: - key then?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (enters the control room) I have a key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you get -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I have a key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, give Moltar your key, and then you and I can go fight that duct guy.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't wanna give Moltar my key.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: They're hard to make!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, I'll go fight the guy. Happy!? (flies off)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Why am I on this show?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) Thank you all for being here. My guest -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (interrupts Moltar) So, uh,  Bill... (looking at his notes) You like blue boobs better? Or green ones?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak, under his breath) Shut up, idiot!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I don't know, uh, this is very strange. You guys are frightening me a little bit, I gotta tell you.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: My guest tonight, the great William Shatner! William Shatner, everybody.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Yes, kudos to me, and congratulations.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mr. Shatner, I gotta tell you (raises his hand, making the "hook 'em horns" gesture): Trek rules, Wars drools!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: There was a, there's a great deal of similarity between Star Wars and Star Trek, I've gotta admit.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Like what?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Space.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looks left and right) Which leads me to the question on everyone's mind -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (interrupts again) Why is everyone on Star Trek black?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (looks like he is about to answer)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looking at his notes) What've you got against white people?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, shut up.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Huh?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I guess we're not on the same wavelength.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: My, my question is: (quietly) can I have your autograph?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I don't sign... my name... anymore.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. I have a business manager to do that.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (nervous laugh)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Would you like my business manager's signature?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What, are you kiddin' me? Great!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aha! (in his best superhero voice) Look here, air conditioning and heating guy! It's time for Space Ghost to blow YOUR ducts. (The red guy starts hammering on the wall again.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: En guard! (He attacks the blue guy, who brandishes a hammer. It is revealed that large boulders are scattered around Zorak's living room. Dramatic music plays, as they hop around the room onto furniture, chasing each other. Space Ghost knocks over a lamp, breaking it. The blue guy hops onto a rock and jumps down.)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And as the Enterprise began its gentle orbing around the planet Vulcan, uh, It was then Kirk, uh, done to... (flips pages) knew the Federation would survive! (flips pages again) Uh, let's see... The End. So... whattya think?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Well... (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Not bad for fan fiction, huh?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I'm afraid to tell you -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not the story you wrote!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yes it is!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Your story had naked men in it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hmph! The laser clothes were his powers!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bouncin' around.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I had to undress him to... disarm him.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So why didn't he just use lasers?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hmph! It was a time before lasers!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (talking in a hick voice) "It was a time before lasers!"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You just need to shut up! (Walks off stage)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (to Bill) So, uh, blue boobs or green boobs?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: You guys are just making me feel very uncomfortable.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aha! (Dramatic music starts again. Space Ghost leaps toward blue guy, and throws a small boulder at him, knocking over the ottoman. They both jump around some more, knocking over lamps and other things. Space Ghost pauses for a few quick breaths, then jumps back and picks up a large boulder) You're mine, duct guy! (He chases the blue guy across the room, toward the red guy, who is still hitting the wall with his hammer.)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, didn't you and I fight to the death?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stops playing and looks at Bill) That sounds pretty dumb, man. (Resumes playing the theremin)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I did, I killed him.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I fought Zorak to the death, I thought.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, you know what I was wondering... Nichelle Nichols ever hit on you?

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (laughing, he touches his mouth and then opens and closes his hand like he is squeezing something.)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Boungy boungy. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I put it on stun quite a bit.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: All right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh no! OH NO!! I killed my best friend ever! (Sad music swells) Why do we always hurt the ones we love? Why, Herve, why? Herve, Herve, HERVE!!!!! (flexes his muscles) (The music stops)

transcript.speaker: Red Guy
transcript.dialogue: Hey, his name was Fernando, man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where's Herve?

transcript.speaker: Red Guy
transcript.dialogue: I'm Herve!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I love a good donkey.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: You can take a donkey by the ear (makes grabbing gesture with his fists) and hold on tight,,,

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, okay...

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: ... and ride across the range, and look really rather romantic.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: While you hold onto the ear, and you're riding bareback.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (excited) You ever been to a donkey show, Bill?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (off camera) Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm... backner?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, you finish blowin' my ducts?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, they're finished. I have scars.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Big deal, Space Ghost. Mr. Shatner here was wounded three times in the Tek Wars.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, right.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's true!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: That's correct. I'm -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's see some scars.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I beg your pardon?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Prove it, tough guy, let's see some scars.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I, I did...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Prove it!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I did, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Prove it!

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: I don't think...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Prove it! (motions with his power bands)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (beat) I'll have to take my pants off.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bill!! It's a trap!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, knock it off.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But his pants are lasers, and he'll be defenseless!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (beat) You and I need to have a talk. (Blood runs into Space Ghost's left eye; a droning sound swells in the background)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: In private. (Space Ghost invisos to the control room) (In a gruff voice) What do you want?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Pfft! You called me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, uh, you got a giant metal hook stickin' outta your head.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Enough of your lies! Moltar, I'm worried about this supercomputer situation.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know you're, you're bleedin' there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's computing things that I don't like, quite frankly.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That's a TV monitor!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (beat) What's that your wearing?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's so sexy and skin-tight, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: S-space Ghost, I, I don't even want ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This supercomputer needs to be destroyed. (Space Ghost reaches into his costume and pulls out a large rock, and starts bashing Moltar's console)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No-no-no-no-no, what are you doing, what are you doing, what are you doing!?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Confound it, I'm left with but one choice.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Great Scott, Space Ghost, not another rock!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Even better! (reaches into his costume, and pulls out a rock) This is the first rock! (bashes the console some more; Bill grimaces on the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No! Whoa, whoa, what are you doing?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am confusing the supercomputer with logic! When it thinks I'm going to hit it with a rock,

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: It's in my hands...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That supercomputer was no match... for my... patented... hmm, something.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (off camera) Space Ghost... (static) Space Ghost... (static) Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (speaking with Bill's voice) I've noticed you really don't have the intelligence to be a really big star.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with Bill's voice) Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Something feels... (blood runs from his eye under his mask, he wipes it off) different.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with Bill's voice) I'm beginning to enjoy being on your show, more than Jay Leno.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (starts yanking on the hook which is stuck in his head. He pulls himself over onto the floor.) Ow. Zorak, give me a hand here, would ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! (A geyser of blood squirts out of Space Ghost's head from where the hook was.)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wow!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, put it back in!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Jackpot!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Put it back it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What is that thing on my head?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's a crown? You're the king.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right. I'm the king.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (leaning up on his elbows) Hey, rocket man, one more thing.

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'd like to name my own price for your big sweet ass. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: William Shatner
transcript.dialogue: (metallic echo) It's in my hands...
